footer.text: Character Guide • Build: Raiden Shogun | Update Date: 11/10/2022 | Editor: ~Z~#0009

fields.name: Best Weapon(s):
fields.value:
__Dragon's Bane__
The highest Elemental Mastery main stat available on a polearm makes this the best option for Raiden as a Hyperbloom unit.

fields.name: Replacement Weapon:
fields.value:
__Moonpiercer, Kitain Cross-Spear__
Alternative forge options if you don't have Dragon's Bane. They offer Elemental Mastery but it's a little under half of Dragon's Bane. Granted the effect of Moonpiercer is potentially useful.

fields.name: Main Stats Priority
fields.value: <sands> Elemental Mastery |<goblet> Elemental Mastery |<circlet> Elemental Mastery

fields.name: Talent Priority
fields.value:
**1)** Elemental Skill: Transcendence: Baleful Omen
**2)** Secret Art: Musou Shinsetsu
**3)** Normal Attack: Origin

fields.name: Notes:
fields.value:
This composition drastically alters Raiden's playstyle as she will no longer be taking the field to use her burst. 

Normal and Burst levels are worthless in this composition. Focus purely on her skill.

Raiden has a unique advantage to being a Hyperbloom unit as her coordinated attacks have an Area of Effect and can hit things like Dendro cores to trigger them while having 100% up time, supplementing Burst Dmg, and a long duration.
